input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is SCOMActor

This wrapper returns the events filtered by the search criteria provided.
Sample Item XML:
<items> <item> <operation-name>get-event</operation-name> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> <command-parameters> <event-search-criteria> <criteria-expression> <key>Id</key> <value>c87591b7-bbea-4ccb-9a38-17fb20e596d5</value> <operator>equals</operator> </criteria-expression> </event-search-criteria> <isrecurse>true</isrecurse> </command-parameters> </item> </items>
armeters Description:
operation-name[Required] Operation that will be executed
timeout-secs[Optional] Time in seconds after which the request will time-out of not completed. Default is: 60 secs
command-parameters[Required] This is the parent tag that contains actual parameters required to execute this particular operation.
event-search-criteria[Optional] This is the parent tag for defining the search criteria.
Following tags are only required if event-search-criteria is provided by user criteria-expression[Required] This is the parent tag which contains details that make up a single search criteria. Multiple 'criteria-expression' tags can be provided under 'event-search-criteria'.
key[Required] This tag contains the event attribute by which the events are filtered. Valid values - Id,OriginalId,MonitoringObjectId,MonitoringClassId,MonitoringObjectName,MonitoringObjectDisplayName,MonitoringObjectPath, MonitoringObjectFullName,MonitoringRuleId,PublisherName,Number,CategoryId,User,Channel,LevelId,LoggingComputer,EventData,ManagementGroupId
value[Required] This tag contains the valid search expression for the attribute specified in the key. Please refer to Criteria guide for valid search criteria expression format. NOTE: For help on writing regular expressions refer to 'Regular Expressions Guide.doc'
operator[Required] The 'operator' tag specified under 'event-search-criteria' tag specifies the operand between multiple 'criteria-expression' tags. Valid values - and, or
The 'operator' tag specified under 'criteria-expression specifies the operand for key and value specified. Valid values - equals, not equals, like, in NOTE: 'in' operator should only be used when 'Id' is used as key
isrecurse[Optional] If true, retrieves events for contained monitoring objects in addition to current monitoring object. Valid values - true, false

documentation.description: This wrapper returns the events filtered by the search criteria provided.
